posts.title: 2021 Top Checkouts Read-Alikes for Adults
posts.text: If you're gearing up for a big year of reading, the most popular checkouts from the past year is a great place to start. We also have many suggestions of other titles, both popular and lesser known, that will scratch the same literary itch.

posts.title: Where to Start with bell hooks
posts.text: For nearly 50 years, bell hooks was an influential thinker, theorist, and cultural critic. Here are a few books that offer a snapshot of hooks as a lover, a writer, a teacher, a thinker, a gender theorist, and a critic.

posts.title: Books We Love: Fall Staff Picks for All Ages
posts.text: If you're looking for something fresh to read, our librarians and staff offer dozens of their favorites for you to "fall back" on.

posts.title: Recommended Reading for "The Last Stand" at Prospect Park
posts.text: This reading list draws out the timely and enduring themes present in Kamala Sankaram’s opera, and the groundbreaking research that inspired it, with books that emphasize the possibilities of kinship with nature.

posts.title: 30 Sizzling Reads for the Last Days of Summer from BIPOC Authors & Creators
posts.text: Check out these new 2021 gems for all ages—they deserve to be at the top of your reading list.

posts.title: 30 Stellar Spring Reads from Diverse Authors and Creators
posts.text: Check out these new 2021 gems for all ages—they deserve to be at the top of your reading list.

posts.title: 15 Books about Genetics for National DNA Day
posts.text: There are plenty of great books that tell compelling stories and that break DNA down into bits (Ts, As, Cs, and Gs) that can be understood by non-experts.

posts.title: Spring Into the Season with NYPL Staff Picks
posts.text: Our librarians are constantly seeking out books to recommend—recent and classic, fun and serious, dense and breezy, for young folks and old.

posts.title: Book Recs for Podcast Fans
posts.text: Podcasts are often good starting points for subjects of interest, and full books are great for that deeper dive.

posts.title: 8 Books about Finance and Hedge Funds for the Uninitiated (or Uninterested)
posts.text: Many of us have had no reason or interest in trying to understand the stock market or hedge funds—until a few days ago when GameStop and short selling stormed into the news cycle. Here are a few books that can help you understand how these financial systems work.

posts.title: Are You Accepting the Read Harder Challenge in 2021?
posts.text: For the last few years, Book Riot has offered readers a wide swath of literary challenges to encourage them to broaden their reading horizons and to step out of their bookish comfort zones. Here are the 2021 challenges, and a few suggestions for each to get you on your way.

posts.title: In a Queue for a Recent Award Winner? Read These While You Wait
posts.text: Many of the fall book awards have been announced, but you may find yourself having a bit of a wait before it gets in your hands (or on your digital device). In the meantime, we have some recommendations to keep you sated.

posts.title: Introducing NYPL's Best Books of 2020
posts.text: The New York Public Library is proud to present our Best Books of 2020. These annual recommendations for kids, teens, and adults, curated by our expert librarians, encompass fiction, nonfiction, graphic novels, poetry, kids’ books in Spanish, and much more. Discover our top 10 books in five categories, then explore the lists in full.

posts.title: Women Are Leaders: A Booklist About Women in Government for Kids & Teens
posts.text: Here are some books for young people about women who have transcended the glass ceiling to serve in positions of power in the US Government, amplifying women's voices and visibility along the way.

posts.title: Veterans' Stories Explored in Fiction
posts.text: Here is some incredible fiction that centers on the soldier's experience, both during war and after they return home.

posts.title: Calling All French Literature Connoisseurs! Albertine Prize 2020
posts.text: From now until November 25, readers all over the world will be able to vote for their favorite book among these selected titles.

posts.title: 15 Eerie and Unnerving Novels That Will Get Under Your Skin
posts.text: Check out these perfect October reads for folks who like spooky but aren’t into horror.

posts.title: Find Your Next Great Read! NYPL Staff Picks, Fall 2020
posts.text: So far, this year has not looked quite how most of us envisioned it. However, books are a source of comfort, entertainment, and education for many folks, and our librarians are still reading amazing books.

posts.title: Always Available: Titles for Pre-K and Kindergarteners
posts.text: There's never a wait for these selections which include beautiful picture books for read alouds, engaging biographies and non-fiction titles to complement science or history lessons.

posts.title: Always Available: Titles for High School Students
posts.text: There's never a wait to access these titles including code cracking, creating digital portfolios, thinking about pollution, the refugee crisis, a plethora of realistic fiction, and more.

posts.title: Always Available: Titles for 3rd, 4th, and 5th Graders
posts.text: There's never a wait for these titles including how-to books, a range of biographies and books about social activism.

posts.title: 10 Books By or About Refugees and Immigrants
posts.text: Our selections include fiction and a graphic novel as well as nonfiction essays and reported journalism.

posts.title: Always Available: Documentary Films for High School Students
posts.text: Documentaries bring history to life through interviews and archival video and photographs to engage students with the past. These selections cover American history, ancient Egypt and jazz music.

posts.title: Always Available: Titles for Middle Grade Students
posts.text: Is your child learning about climate change, the Immigration Act or Ancient Egypt? These and other nonfictiontopics, along with fiction and graphic novel selections are always available to be checked out—no waiting.

posts.title: Always Available: Titles for 1st and 2nd Graders
posts.text: There's never a wait for these titles including appealing biographies, science and STEM picks and books that impart life lessons.

posts.title: New & Noteworthy 2020 Middle Grade Reads
posts.text: There is no shortage of new books to get excited about!

posts.title: New and Noteworthy: Picture Books 2020
Discover New Reads for Pride Month 2020
posts.text: Some are recently published and some have been around for awhile—but they're all available digitally through our SimplyE app.

posts.title: New & Noteworthy: YA Fiction
posts.text: Although the NYPL branches are currently closed, the members of our Best Books committees are still hard at work, getting excited about the books that are coming out in 2020. Here are a few YA novels that have them buzzing already.

posts.title: 12 Books to Read for Nurse Appreciation Week
posts.text: This year more than ever before we owe a huge debt of gratitude to nurses.

posts.title: Spring 2020 Book Picks for Adults
posts.text: We hope that there's something here for every reader.

posts.title: Books Written by Beloved Podcast Hosts
posts.text: Run out of your favorite podcast episodes? Try a book from the same mind.

posts.title: Movie and Television-Adjacent Reads That Are Always Available
posts.text: You've seen them on screen, now read the public domain classic.

posts.title: 2020 Bernstein Awards Finalist Spotlight: 'A Good Provider is One Who Leaves' by Jason DeParle
posts.text: DeParle masterfully uses a singular story to illustrate the interconnected forces that shape human migration.

posts.title: What Would Your Pet Read?
posts.text: Our staff shares which books their pets would be into, how about yours?

posts.title: “Project Reads:” 7 Always-Available Novels That You’ve Always Meant To Read
posts.text: Your high school English teacher will be so proud.

posts.title: The SimplyE Collection: Contemporary Digital Gems Available to All (Even Without a Library Card)
posts.text: Avoid the holds queue...

posts.title: The Librarian's Secret Weapon: NoveList
posts.text: And how you can access it, too.

posts.title: 15 Books About Jobs More Interesting Than Yours
posts.text: Take a deep dive into a profession that you hadn't really thought about.

posts.title: 14 Time-Traipsing Novels for Leap Year
posts.text: Leap into a great book about time or time travel.

posts.title: Bookish Feline-themed Gifts for Cat Lovers
posts.text: With fall now in full swing, even the most independent cats suddenly become tolerant of us humans. Now's the time to get cozy with your cat, a good book, and any of these cat-themed items.

posts.title: 10 Gifts for Rising Seniors and College Students
posts.text: As you map out your fall schedule, here are some great ways to keep it all organized and look stylish while doing it.

posts.title: 12 LGBT Favorites for Pride Month
posts.text: We've discovered some great recently published LGBT books, unearthed some classics, and have a couple titles for kids, too. Celebrate Pride Month by checking out these recommended titles.

posts.title: School's Out: 10 Gifts for Grads, Treats for Teachers
posts.text: Whether you're showing gratitude to a teacher or providing inspiration to a new graduate, the Library Shop has the right gifts.

posts.title: 11 Bookish Gifts For the Women in Your Life
posts.text: Say thank you to all the moms in your life, no matter what form their mothering takes, with one of these 11 finds from the Library Shop.

posts.title: Celebrating Women's History Month at the NYPL Shop
posts.text: From women who helped shaped our beloved New York City to 18th and 19th century female authors who hid their names, we highlight legendary women with a fantastic collection of gifts at the NYPL Shop.

posts.title: Top 10 Gifts from The New York Public Library Shop
posts.text: More than half the items featured are original designs that range from calendars to ornaments and jewelry, and include an Italian leather backpack, and even a new quote tote. Check them out!

posts.title: 13 Literary Sports Books (and One Movie) That Go for the Gold
posts.text: We hope you’ll enjoy some of these Olympic-event-themed novels and literary memoirs that examine sports in our everyday lives and the more philosophical and meditative aspects of exertion and competition.
